intro: Hohenbergia stellata, commonly known as the star hohenbergia, is a species of flowering plant in the Bromeliaceae family. It is native to Brazil and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a compact, compact, and often dense structure. The leaves are typically dark green with a waxy coating and can develop a reddish or purple hue under certain conditions. It produces small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale pink, emerging from the center of the rosette. This plant is well-suited for indoor cultivation due to its low light requirements and ability to thrive in humid environments.
